issue.title: Invalid host key error not caught
issue.body:
If the `~.ssh/known_hosts` file contains an invalid entry (in my case, caused by a missing newline) then PyEZ will only return the nondescript `ConnectError` message.

The failure comes from the **ncclient** `manager.connect()` function which, in turn, calls **paramiko**'s `load_known_hosts()`. The latter actually returns a clear error message:

```
InvalidHostKey: ('172.22.196.114 ssh-rsa AAAA...
    <snip />
    ...+SQ==', Error('Incorrect padding',))
```

I think there are 2 issues here:
1. **ncclient** `manager.connect()` takes several arguments, one of which is `hostkey_verify` which we set to `False` so I believe we should not even be loading the `known_hosts` file. I played with different parameters and we always seem to be performing this verification - this is a ncclient bug in my opinion.
2. PyEZ obfuscates the error by using the generic ConnectError message - this occurs in the following bit of code in the `device.py` file:

``` python
        except Exception as err:
            # anything else, we will re-raise as a
            # generic ConnectError
            cnx_err = EzErrors.ConnectError(self)
            cnx_err._orig = err
            raise cnx_err
```

If we were to `raise cnx_err._orig` instead then we would have a clearer picture of what's going on.

body: Fair point. Also, OpenSSH's implementation certainly doesn't seem to be as picky, and we generally use them as a guide for behavior. I'd merge a PR that implements this. EDIT: should also see if any have been submitted previously first...

On Fri, 27 Feb 2015, Jeff Forcier wrote:

> [...] EDIT: should also see if any have been submitted previously first...

Related pull requests include #404 (Add informative BadHostKeyException).

issue.title: Silently ignore invalid keys in HostKeys.load()

repository.name: paramiko
repository.description: The leading native Python SSHv2 protocol library.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
When broken entries exists in known_hosts, paramiko raises SSHException
with "Invalid key". This patch catches the exception during
HostKeys.load() and continues to next line.

This should fix #490.

issue.title: Server <server name> not found in known_hosts

repository.name: paramiko
repository.description: The leading native Python SSHv2 protocol library.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
I am trying to connect my ipython kernel to an existing kernel running on another machine through ssh.  I was having trouble there and opened up an issue there that can be found here:

https://github.com/ipython/ipython/issues/8439

With some guidance, it appears the issue is with paramiko.  

For reference, I am running this on Windows 8.1 x64, I'm using git-bash for my command line work.  I have python 3.4.3 installed and paramiko 1.15.2.

```
ogi@OGI-DESKTOP ~/Downloads
$ ssh ogi@hwvmsrv
Welcome to Ubuntu 14.04.2 LTS (GNU/Linux 3.16.0-37-generic x86_64)

 * Documentation:  https://help.ubuntu.com/

  System information as of Sun May 17 17:06:06 PDT 2015

  System load:  0.0                Processes:           106
  Usage of /:   31.6% of 17.58GB   Users logged in:     1
  Memory usage: 5%                 IP address for eth0: 192.168.1.130
  Swap usage:   0%

  Graph this data and manage this system at:
    https://landscape.canonical.com/

0 packages can be updated.
0 updates are security updates.

Last login: Sun May 17 17:06:07 2015 from 192.168.1.120
ogi@hwvmsrv:~$ exit
logout
Connection to hwvmsrv closed.

ogi@OGI-DESKTOP ~/Downloads
$ ipython
Python 3.4.3 |Continuum Analytics, Inc.| (default, Mar  6 2015, 12:06:10) [MSC v
.1600 64 bit (AMD64)]
Type "copyright", "credits" or "license" for more information.

IPython 3.1.0 -- An enhanced Interactive Python.
Anaconda is brought to you by Continuum Analytics.
Please check out: http://continuum.io/thanks and https://binstar.org
?         -> Introduction and overview of IPython's features.
%quickref -> Quick reference.
help      -> Python's own help system.
object?   -> Details about 'object', use 'object??' for extra details.

In [1]: import paramiko

In [2]: client = paramiko.SSHClient()

In [3]: client.load_system_host_keys()

In [4]: server = 'hwvmsrv'

In [5]: username = 'ogi'

In [6]: port = 22

In [7]: keyfile = "C:\\Users\\ogi\\.ssh\\id_rsa"

In [8]: client.connect(server, port, username=username, key_filename=keyfile, lo
ok_for_keys=True)
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
SSHException                              Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-8-68c07a1ff1cf> in <module>()
----> 1 client.connect(server, port, username=username, key_filename=keyfile, lo
ok_for_keys=True)

c:\Users\ogi\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\paramiko\client.py in connect(self, ho
stname, port, username, password, pkey, key_filename, timeout, allow_agent, look
_for_keys, compress, sock, gss_auth, gss_kex, gss_deleg_creds, gss_host, banner_
timeout)
    286                 # will raise exception if the key is rejected; let that
fall out
    287                 self._policy.missing_host_key(self, server_hostkey_name,

--> 288                                               server_key)
    289                 # if the callback returns, assume the key is ok
    290                 our_server_key = server_key

c:\Users\ogi\Miniconda3\lib\site-packages\paramiko\client.py in missing_host_key
(self, client, hostname, key)
    568         client._log(DEBUG, 'Rejecting %s host key for %s: %s' %
    569                     (key.get_name(), hostname, hexlify(key.get_fingerpri
nt())))
--> 570         raise SSHException('Server %r not found in known_hosts' % hostna
me)
    571
    572

SSHException: Server 'hwvmsrv' not found in known_hosts
```

first line of known_hosts file (in same directory as id_rsa file)

```
hwvmsrv,192.168.1.130 ecdsa-sha2-nistp256 <key>
```

Any suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

issue.title: If a single known_hosts line is problematic, paramiko bombs

repository.name: paramiko
repository.description: The leading native Python SSHv2 protocol library.

license.name: GNU Lesser General Public License v2.1

issue.body:
A previous issue resulted in paramiko continuing if meeting an `SSHException` whilst parsing known_hosts. See https://github.com/paramiko/paramiko/issues/490

However, I've just run into a `Invalid EC key` error, which is raised as `ValueError` (see exception trace below) and hence still manages to bomb the whole process.

```
Debug: Establishing ssh connection with 'zimmer-vault.stonethree.com' through port '22' as user 'cpbotha'
Debug: SELECT count from state_info WHERE rowid=1
Debug: fetched: [(12,)]
Debug: UPDATE state_info SET count = 12 WHERE rowid = 1
Error: Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/dvc/command/data_sync.py", line 46, in do_run
    with_deps=self.args.with_deps)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/dvc/project.py", line 765, in push
    show_checksums=show_checksums)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/dvc/data_cloud.py", line 117, in push
    show_checksums=show_checksums)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/dvc/remote/local.py", line 721, in push
    exists = remote.exists(remote.md5s_to_path_infos(md5s))
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/dvc/remote/ssh.py", line 106, in exists
    port=self.port)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/dvc/remote/ssh.py", line 86, in ssh
    ssh.load_system_host_keys()
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/paramiko/client.py", line 104, in load_system_host_keys
    self._system_host_keys.load(filename)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/paramiko/hostkeys.py", line 97, in load
    e = HostKeyEntry.from_line(line, lineno)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/paramiko/hostkeys.py", line 360, in from_line
    key = ECDSAKey(data=decodebytes(key), validate_point=False)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/paramiko/ecdsakey.py", line 168, in __init__
    self.verifying_key = numbers.public_key(backend=default_backend())
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/primitives/asymmetric/ec.py", line 329, in public_key
    return backend.load_elliptic_curve_public_numbers(self)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/backends/openssl/backend.py", line 1381, in load_elliptic_curve_public_numbers
    ec_cdata, numbers.x, numbers.y)
  File "/Users/cpbotha/Library/Python/3.6/lib/python/site-packages/cryptography/hazmat/backends/openssl/backend.py", line 1648, in _ec_key_set_public_key_affine_coordinates
    raise ValueError("Invalid EC key.")
ValueError: Invalid EC key.
```
